doctype.comment: Both dictionaries and terminlogy contain element declarations for gram

externalIdRef.name: tei2.dtd
externalIdRef.comment: TEI P4 DTD. Generated May 2001 by dtdGen
[DSTTEI2] 3.6.1: File tei2.dtd: Main document type declaration file
Text Encoding Initiative: Guidelines for Electronic Text Encoding and Interchange. Document TEI P3, 1994.
Copyright (c) 1994 ACH, ACL, ALLC. Permission to copy in any form is granted, provided this notice is included in all copies.
These materials subject to revision. Current versions are available from the Text Encoding Initiative.

This file first defines some useful entities, then defines the element TEI.2 and includes files with the various specialized parts of the document type declaration. It also declares the top-level TEI.2 and TEI.2.corpus elements.
Embed any local modifications to TEI entities.
Embed local modifications to TEI parameter entities. Declare entity as empty string first, in case user has no mods and has not declared it.
Embed entities for TEI generic identifiers.
This includes defining the default for each base and additional tag set as 'IGNORE', and initialising the tag omissibility indicator entities depending on the value of TEI.XML
We declare and immediately embed the TEI keywords file.

externalIdRef.name: TEI.keywords.ent
externalIdRef.comment: TEI P4 DTD. Generated May 2001 by dtdGen
I. Declare TEI keywords for data types.
These parameter entities are used as keywords to express rules or constraints which cannot be fully expressed in SGML; their expansions show the nearest SGML equivalent.
II. Declare keywords for tag-set selection.
Declare all bases and additional tag sets as 'IGNORE'. The user can override this default by declaring the same entity with the replacement text 'INCLUDE', in the document's DTD subset.
III. Declare TEI.XML and associated omissibility indicators
II. Define element classes for content models, shared attributes for element classes, and global attributes. (This all happens within the file TEIclas2.ent.)

externalIdRef.name: TEI.elementClasses
externalIdRef.comment: TEI P4 DTD. Generated May 2001 by dtdGen
Text Encoding Initiative: Guidelines for Electronic Text Encoding and Interchange. Document TEI P3, 1994.
Copyright (c) 1994 ACH, ACL, ALLC. Permission to copy in any form is granted, provided this notice is included in all copies.
These materials subject to revision. Current versions are available from the Text Encoding Initiative.
First, we declare the 'low-level' core classes: these are classes of semantically and structurally similar elements declared as part of the core tag set, e.g. the classes 'data' or 'edit'.
Most of these elements are in the core tag set, but some may be from other tag sets.

Next, we declare the 'high-level' classes: these group together all phrase-level elements, all inter-level elements, and all chunk-level elements in the core, and identify the 'common' component elements (chunks and inter-level elements), as opposed to the tagset-specific components.
These are the three fundamental element classes.
This class isolates all the common component-level elements.

Next, we embed the portions of each base and additional tag set which declare relevant parameter entities. Only those files are embedded which have been selected by the user in the DTD subset. These files will declare parameter entities for their component-level elements, as well as for any global attributes they define.

externalIdRef.name: TEI.verse.ent
externalIdRef.comment: TEI P4 DTD. Generated May 2001 by dtdGen
[DVEE] 9.1: Base Tag Set for Verse: entities
Text Encoding Initiative: Guidelines for Electronic Text Encoding and Interchange. Document TEI P3, 1994.
Copyright (c) 1994 ACH, ACL, ALLC. Permission to copy in any form is granted, provided this notice is included in all copies.
These materials subject to revision. Current versions are available from the Text Encoding Initiative.
First, declare the class of components specific to verse
Next define attributes common to metrical elements
Now, we define the class of elements which can appear only within metrical elements

These materials subject to revision. Current versions are available from the Text Encoding Initiative.
First we define attributes available on all the elements in this tag set.
Next we define comp.dictionaries, which will be used in the declaration of component, within file TEI2.DTD.
Next, we declare some specialized element classes, used in various content models in the dictionary tag set.
[DEDIEN] 12.2.2: Class for top-level structure of dictionary entries
[DEDITPFO] 12.3.1: Classes for morphological and form information
[DEDIFR] 12.6: Model class for unstructured dictionary entries

This entity declares the class of elements defined specifically for use in dictionary entries, except those which are included in the phrase class. This class is used in defining the 'free' dictionary entry.

These materials subject to revision. Current versions are available from the Text Encoding Initiative.
Add attributes to the set of global attributes:

externalIdRef.comment: TEI P4 DTD. Generated May 2001 by dtdGen
[DNDENT] 20.: Additional classes for names and dates

externalIdRef.name: TEI.figures.ent
externalIdRef.comment: TEI P4 DTD. Generated May 2001 by dtdGen
We can now declare the standard content models; one of these varies with the base selected.
Here we declare the parameter entities phrase, phrase.seq, component, component.seq, paraContent, and specialPara, for use in the content models of element declarations.
The entities phrase and phrase.seq are the same in all bases. They may include elements specific to single tag sets; if the tag set is not selected, these elements are undefined and have no effect.
The entity component varies with the base. The versions for the combined bases are declared first (so as to take precedence over the declarations in the individual bases).
[DSTECMX] 3.7.8: Definition of components for combined bases
Default declarations for the 'mix.' entities used for mixed and general bases.
externalIdRef.ignoredSection: <!ENTITY % TEI.singleBase 'IGNORE' > <!--The mixed base allows components from any base; it does so by defining 'component' as including both common components and those specific to one tag set.--> <!ENTITY % component '(%m.common; %mix.verse; %mix.drama; %mix.spoken; %mix.dictionaries; %mix.terminology;)' >

includedSection.comment: The general base uses the same definition of component as the mixed base.

But it defines a special version of component.seq, which restricts each div of the text to a single base: bases can shift only in embedded divs or at div boundaries. This entity is constructed out of a series of smaller entities, one for each tag set. If the tag set is not in use, its entity will expand to the empty string.
If the verse base is in use, ...
If the drama base is in use, ...
If the spoken base is in use, ...
If the dictionary base is in use, ...
If the terminology base is in use, ...
Default declarations for all the entities gen.verse, etc.
Now we are ready to declare component.seq and component.plus for use in general base tag set.
(End of marked section for general base.)

externalIdRef.comment: The entity component.seq is always a starred sequence of component elements. Its definition does not vary with the base (unless we are using the general base, in which case it has already been defined above), but the meaning of the definition does.
The following entities do not vary with the base.
Finally, we declare the attribute classes, including the global attributes.
The global attributes are defined for every element in the TEI tag set; individual declarations may be overridden by local declarations for individual elements.

If the tag sets invoked by the user define extra global attributes (they do this in their .ent file), then they are inherited by GLOBAL; otherwise the parameter entities referred to expand to the empty string, as shown here.
The TEIform attribute is also global, but is declared individually for each element, not in a parameter entity declaration.
III. Define the top-level TEI elements: one for individual texts, one for composites with a collective header.
A TEI document is a text preceded by a TEI header.
A TEI corpus is a series of TEI.2 documents, preceded by a corpus-level TEI header.

IV. Embed the actual tag sets. First embed any local modifications and extensions. Then embed the core tag sets, the (single) base tag set, and the (optional) additional tag sets specified by the user.
Embedding local modifications here allows user modifications to use all the standard TEI element classes and parameter entities.
These occur in all documents and are therefore defined unconditionally.

externalIdRef.name: TEI.header.dtd
externalIdRef.comment: TEI P4 DTD. Generated May 2001 by dtdGen
Text Encoding Initiative: Guidelines for Electronic Text Encoding and Interchange. Document TEI P3, 1994.
Copyright (c) 1994 ACH, ACL, ALLC. Permission to copy in any form is granted, provided this notice is included in all copies.
These materials subject to revision. Current versions are available from the Text Encoding Initiative.
The TITLE, AUTHOR, NAME, RESPSTMT, and RESP elements are declared in file teicore2.dtd, not here.
The PUBLISHER, PUBPLACE, and ADDRESS elements are defined in file teicore2.dtd.
The NOTE element is defined with the core tags.
respStmt, item, and date are declared in teicore2.

externalIdRef.name: TEI.core.dtd
externalIdRef.comment: TEI P4 DTD. Generated May 2001 by dtdGen
[DCO] 6.12: Elements available in all forms of the TEI main DTD
Definition of elements, sub-group by sub-group.
Other components of addresses should be represented using the general purpose NAME element
Note and date are defined elsewhere, as are extent, address, and idno.
A different base will be embedded, depending on which parameter entity has been declared by the user with the value 'INCLUDE'.

externalIdRef.name: TEI.prose.dtd
externalIdRef.comment: TEI P4 DTD. Generated May 2001 by dtdGen
Text Encoding Initiative: Guidelines for Electronic Text Encoding and Interchange. Document TEI P3, 1994.
Copyright (c) 1994 ACH, ACL, ALLC. Permission to copy in any form is granted, provided this notice is included in all copies.
These materials subject to revision. Current versions are available from the Text Encoding Initiative.

This base tag set does nothing but declare and embed the default text structure. When it is selected, therefore, the only tags available are those in the core and those defined in other selected tag sets.

externalIdRef.name: TEI.verse.dtd
externalIdRef.comment: TEI P4 DTD. Generated May 2001 by dtdGen
First, declare the default text structure, which is the same for verse as it is for other kinds of text. (But declare it only if verse is the only base.)
Finally, declare the elements specific to this base tag set

externalIdRef.name: termtags
externalIdRef.comment: TEI P4 DTD. Generated May 2001 by dtdGen

The nested structure is used for data interchange and represents a canonical structured form for terminology entries, which differs from the less structured forms frequently used to store data in terminological databases.
Notes, descrip(s) and admin(s) are allowed in the termEntry to provide documentation that applies to the whole entry.
Order is significant: term, descrip(s), ofig(s) or otherform(s)
We define a.dictionaries as the empty string, since we are not now using the tag set for dictionaries.

[DDSDIVX] 7.2.4: Tags for start and end of divisions

Front matter is defined in TEI.front file.
